intro: Septas capensis var. albertinae, commonly known as the Albertina's rockrose, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are thick and cylindrical, often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months.
